summary: Edits two 'system' quests to allow mostly any humanoid NPC to become a follower.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=20]WHAT THIS REQUIRES[/size][/center]

Tes5edit <<< If you want this mod to be any use, anyway.

Works best with EFF but now compatible with vanilla, UFO and AFT.

[center][size=20]HOW TO INSTALL[/center][/size]

1. Pick your poison - now supports both Vanilla/UFO/AFT builds as well as EFF/XFL.

2. Download Convincing Coinage if you want to be able to hire any NPC.

3. Extract the file archives into your Skyrim root directory (where TESV.exe is).

4. Activate mods

5(Optional). Install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14884/?]Fus-Ro-D'Oh[/url] <-- Requires SKSE

6. Play Skyrim

Note: The custom version of Convincing Coinage allows you to:

A) Bribe people to increase your relationshiprank with them.

B) Add people to the relevant system factions, allowing them to become Followers (and marriable too!)

If you'd rather not have to talk to every new NPC in order to recruit them, using Tes5edit and running the attached script will allow for that, at the expense of taking a potentially large amount of time.

[center]Second Method[/center]

[color=IndianRed]2. Run Tes5edit

3. Working from the bottom of the modlist to the top (E.G, Bounc'N'Juggs2000.esp, Bounc'N'Masterfile.esm, Dragonborn.esm, Hearthfires.esm, Dawnguard.esm, Skyrim.esm), select all the Non-Player Character records.

4. Right-click. Use your fingers to push down the mouse button furthest away from you (supposing you're right handed). If you're left handed, consider undergoing surgery.

5. Deep Copy As Override.

6. Tick the checkbox next to "New File". You only need to do this step once. You can deep-copy from other plugins into the newly made file.

7. Enter the new file's name.

8. Press enter.

9. Once all the necessary NPC records have been copied over, select the ones in your new file.

10. Right-click. If necessary, get an adult to supervise the aforementioned physical activity.

11. Apply script.

12. Select "AAA_Mator_PotentialFollowerMarriage_CurrentFollower.pas"

13. Press OK.

14. Let it work it's magic.

15. When the script has finished, click that red X on the top-right corner of the screen.

16. Click OK.

17. Activate the newly made file in your load order

18. Play Skyrim.[/color]


[center][size=20]WHAT THIS DOES[/size][/center]


Allows for a much wider range of voice types for followers (33 were added!)


[center][size=20]HOW IT WORKS[/size][/center]


By modifying two dialogue quests pertaining to recruiting followers, I have managed to make the majority of NPCs be a potential follower. See that guard with chronic knee pain? In vanilla, you would not be able to hire him, even if he had the relevant factions and relationship ranks. With this mod, however? Now ya can! AND WITH DIALOGUE! And lipsync! And blackjack! And hookers!

Well, maybe not the Blackjack. But hey, hookers!

There were an adequate number of dialogue files for each of the vanilla voice types, so you'll actually see the NPC's lips move and hear their voice. Pretty nifty eh?

It should be, I had to run my computer for 8 hours to just decompile ALL OF the .fuz files, just to get at nine lines of dialogue for each voice type.


[center][size=20]WHAT IT CONFLICTS WITH[/size][/center]


Any mod which modifies the topics in the FavorDialogue and DialogueFollower quests.



[center][size=20]CREDITS[/center][/size]
Matortheeternal for creating that sexy-ass Tes5edit script. That guy's a god. A sexy-ass god. You should make a shrine to him.
author: FiftyTifty

files.name: AAA_FyTy_XFL_Voicetype_Extension_v1_02
files.changelogHtml:
Unlocked functional dialogs formerly locked to NPCs instead of voicetypes (i.e. Mjoll, Erandur, Belrand, etc.)
Added dummy NPCs flagged at Rank 0 of CurrentFollowerFaction to fix missing dialog bug
Added vanilla/UFO/AFT compatible version.

files.name: Follower Voice Types Expanded 1.2.1
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed the dialogue scripts a while back.

Figured out why NPCs with the DLC2FemaleDarkElfCommoner voicetype wouldn't have the "Follow me, I need your help." dialogue; added a formlist to the dialogue quest conditions to include it.
